questions.question: A tangent PQ at a point P of a circle of radius 5 cm meets a line through the center O at a point Q such that OQ = 12 cm. Find the length of PQ.
questions.explanation: Since radius is perpendicular to the tangent, OPQ is a right triangle. PQ² = OQ² - OP² = 12² - 5² = 144 - 25 = 119. So, PQ = √119 cm.

questions.question: A chord of length 16 cm is at a distance of 6 cm from the center of a circle. What is the radius of the circle?
questions.explanation: The perpendicular from the center bisects the chord. Leg 1 = 8 cm, Leg 2 = 6 cm. Radius² = 8² + 6² = 100. Radius = 10 cm.

questions.question: If the angle subtended by an arc at the center is 110°, what is the angle subtended by it at the circumference?
questions.explanation: The angle at the center is double the angle at the circumference. 110 / 2 = 55°.

questions.question: In a cyclic quadrilateral ABCD, if ∠A = 80°, what is the measure of ∠C?
questions.explanation: Opposite angles in a cyclic quadrilateral are supplementary (sum to 180°). 180 - 80 = 100°.

questions.question: What is the perimeter of a semi-circle with radius 7 cm? (Use π = 22/7)
The length of the tangent from an external point P to a circle is 24 cm. If the distance of P from the center is 25 cm, find the radius.
questions.explanation: Using Pythagoras theorem: Radius² = 25² - 24² = 625 - 576 = 49. Radius = 7 cm.

questions.question: If two circles of radii 5 cm and 3 cm touch each other internally, what is the distance between their centers?
questions.explanation: For internal touching, distance between centers = R - r = 5 - 3 = 2 cm.
